name: Dunnet Bay Caravan and Motorhome Club Site
location: Dunnet Bay Club Site, Dunnet, Thurso, Highlands KW14 8XD, UK
comments: Great little site beside a fabulous beach. Facilities are immaculate like all club sites. Pitches are all grass but the ground drains reasonably on all but a few. It is quite near the road so there is some road noise on the back pitches but only during the day.
Great site next to the beach and the beach is sandy and just goes on and on .....grest facilities. ..but its best to book first....a popular site and it gets fully booked
Open grassy site with expected caravan club facilities.  Path down through dunes which obscure view to a spectacular sandy beach. Views across to Orkney and RSPB cliffs

Good caravan club site all facilities very clean although others say it is a peaceful site I would add that the noise from the main road is quite intrusive at night and also because it is a 1night stop place for many the noise made by people departing early can affect those wanting a bit of a sleep in on a morning whilst the site is all grass and in my opinion should stay that way I think the club could level some of the pitches out in the closed season by adding top soil and seeding as more and more motorhome are getting heavier this should be undertaken 
 regularly

Nice site with beautiful beach!!
Pitches not very well laid out. Creating some pitch overrun

name: Cobar Caravan Park
comments:
The site was a drive through site with plenty of room. The older toilet block was clean but broken basin needs replacing. No hand cleaner in the dispenser and no hand towels.  There is a newer amenities block but did not use it as it was a little further away. 

Otherwise park well set out and convenient to town. Staff were friendly. Would like to see  an extension of concrete slab to accommodate van awning instead of red soil. Thanks - Keith.
Pleasant surrounds with a variety of bird life. Clean amenities. Helpful staff. Easy access.

Good campsite
Staff friendly and helpful even arranged for firewood to be chopped for me so I could have a camp fire.
Container Cabin well fitted out perfect for a short stay
I have stayed here over the last 8 years and is one of my favorite parks, very friendly staff plus always clean and tidy,nice and quiet,I will keep staying here.

Stopped here the night of 13th november 2017. Quite a large caravan park with large, grassy sites. Good amenities block, fantastic camp kitchen. Highlight of the stay was saying g'day to the maintenance man this morning as he was cleaning the camp kitchen :-) otherwise, just a quick stop over  (5 stars is for his friendliness and big smile)

name: 7 Oaks Sapphire Fossicking And Bush Camping
comments: Been coming here for a few years. Campsite is like a slice of heaven. Absolute peace and natural beauty. Peter and Nicole are wonderful people. Found a 3.5ct Blue Sapphire on my first trip! :-D
As always it was a great out and it was nice to find some 'cutters'. Very pleasant surroundings with basic amenities.

We had a wonderful day fossicking at 7Oaks. The set up was great! Had a picnic under the trees - water & dunny's supplied! Found a few sapphires - not good enough to retire on - but it was fun looking. Many thanks for a great day. :)

name: Pindari Dam
comments: Beautiful free camping with hot showers. Perfect views.

This place is utopia if you enjoy fishing and camping; whether for a weekend or a week. There is plenty of room for your tent or camper. Ample toilets, garbage bins, and picnic shelters - but nothing else, so make sure you bring everything that you will need.
The road to Pindari from the west is the best way to get here, as it is all bitumen. If you come from the east, you will need to travel many kilometres of gravel road. Whichever direction you come from, it's a great drive in the country.
Bring the family out to the dam for one day and have a picnic, you'll enjoy it.

comments:
This place is a hidden gem. You will love the tented rooms and the price is fair on the upper side of your wallet since they charge per head, not per room. The food is ok for a place that makes their meals fresh on order since they don't get much visitors' traffic. The road to the lodge is a piece of art, don't go without a 4WD. Visa/MasterCard/Amex don't work although there is a beautiful sign that says they accept cards, cash rules on this side or the plains. 
If you are lucky like our group, elephants will be grazing nearby.

access road is awful

4x4 is must 

very fantastic night there

they are only 20m
and sunset to the lake is perfect

you must bring your food and drink

comments: Beautiful location in the middle of the plantation. The campsite is not high on luxury as it pays attention to being eco-friendly, right from the plates to the way the construction is done. The staff are local hill tribes who are friendly and go out of their way to make your stay comfortable
Truly heavens ledge. Beautiful place. Perfect getaway to relax with friends and family.
Great place to enjoy alone or with loved ones ,good service too. I was all alone when it rained gracefully!
An awesome place very beautiful view of the sunrise and the sunset . Different experience which was very pleasant and peaceful.

This place is amazing of you at looking for a weekend escape from all the city sounds.

name: Menzi Beach Park and Campsite
location: Martinez Ave, Mati, Davao Oriental, Philippines
comments: Great place to spend some R&R time with family and friends. The place has cottages and tables, plus they allow tent rentals. There is enough parking space. The beach - breathtaking. The waves - surf-worthy. The sand - powder-like. The cleanliness is maintained. Personnel empty the trash bins per cottage/area from time to time, and also make sure they accommodate you upon arrival. The management made sure they maintained the natural ambience by keeping the trees and other plants as is. The only problem was the comfort room: non-functioning toilet flushes and faucets in the washing area plus very low water pressure. My best friend and I had to share showers and before we were done, 4 people + 2 kids were waiting in line for us to finish. They should have made sure there was enough water pressure to accommodate the amount of customers and their bathing/washing needs. Though the good part was that maintenance personnel kept it acceptably clean; however, they stopped ‚Äòcaring‚Äô once customers started flooding in. Dogs and cats were also roaming around which should somehow have been controlled. All in all, it was a great experience and we would still come back. I would also recommend this to my family and friends. Hopefully, improvements would be made with the CR soon.

Nice resort with cottages but it gets full during the weekend.  You can stay in the beach though and have a picnic.  Tents are available but can only be rented for the evening.  The water is clear but you have to fight waves during swimming.  The ambiance is perfect for romantic dates or solitary reminisce.
Nice for surfer. But not for smaller kids. Bigger waves and the current coyld be dangerous.

A wide beach front and open cottages, a great place to relax and enjoy the sun, sand, wind, and the sound of waves. For the not so excellent swimmers, the water is enjoyable when it's calm. The waves here are too short for surfing, but it's big for swimmers. The price is reasonable compared to other beaches. The toilets are clean and have running water. There some stores wherein you can borrow utensils or have them cook the food you bought from the wet market. Banig, tents, mosquito nets, and boards can be rented here as well. This area is safe since it is government  managed. This place is popular on the weekends
Resort is clean and secured. No rooms, only open cottages and tents so if you have a tent, bring it. Beach is amazing!

name: Campingplatz & Herberge Grein
comments:
PROS: quite shady, a view of the river (if you are lucky), within walking distance from the town center and nice restaurants, you can camp wherever you want to, no official plaque, no checks by the manager...
CONS: manager (not Austrian !!!) doesn't care much about the condition of the campground and the washrooms, a bit disorganized (seems more interested in dealing with cars and offering taxi rides to events in the area), campground rather expensive and dark at night, close to main road, drainage after rain almost nonexistent...

Very expensive (‚Ç¨ 26 for tent, two adults, one child) and very noisy from heavy traffic. Sanitary building was dirty. The restaurant looked like a western saloon, and the owner was tired of his job. All in all - don't go there if you can avoid it. Positive things: Shade from trees, and a lot of space to pitch tent.

Eitherway,  place is nice,  nice grass and shadow,  but... guest are,  obviosly what this camp deserves. Dirty and rude

Stunning location. Really. We took the cute mobile house which was really comfy. In the campaign there is pretty good restaurant which is rare. The small town is pretty, worth a visit.

Er is 1 ruime douche en enkele toiletten. Sanitair is prima en schoon. De varkensstal wordt mechanisch geventileerd. Gelijk aan het geluid van een koelwagen hier sta je niet direct naast, voor ons niet storend maar je hoort het wel. Wij kwamen op woensdag om 18.30u aan en konden hier niet warm eten. Er was wel genoeg ruimte om de caravan aangekoppeld te laten achter de auto.

Gewoon een stuk tuin waarin je kon camperen. Geen kaart voor restaurant maar schnitzel en patat waren verder prima. 1 douche met daarbij ook het afwas gedeelte. Niet erg handig. Sanitair wel schoon. Je kon de varkens goed horen. Typische boerencamping. Heerlijk rustig  s nachts. We komen  nog eens terug als we in de buurt zijn. Cash geld mee. Je kan niet pinnen.

Kleine und ruhige Campingoase. Sehr freundlich und sauber. Auch Hunde sind willkommen!

comments: Nice little camp field though probably not for those looking for quiet rest - too close to a busy highway, railway track and airport's runway.
Perfect place camping, very clean and Green!
Stayed one night, rather boring place, average costs, toilets and showers ok.
Clean and nice place. Quite small but it's not a disadvantage. It's located at a small lake to which there is no direct access from the camping.

Probably the worst campsite I used on my week long tour of the Danube. It's  a fair cycle ride to Linz. 50 cents to use the showers if I remember rightly. The pitch has hardly any grass on it. The attached restaurant was OK though.

Besuche jedes Jahr dort meine Verwandschaft. Campingplatz mit Blick auf die Donau, Ufer mit Steine und Sand, Freibad, jedes mal nette Leute,... einfach alles da was man braucht.

name: Campeggio Rivabella
location: Via alla Spiaggia, 35, 23900 Lecco LC, Italy
comments:
Beautiful located under big trees. Camping pits as close as ten meters to the lake are available. The shores of the lake are covered with small stones but swimming is not a problem. The camping area gives you a close to nature feeling and there are a lot of places to relax. Drawback:
There are spiders everywhere, the toilettes, the showers and even at the place where you usually do the dishes. I'm not afraid of spiders, but i really felt disgusted by the spiders close to your body while showering. It kind of takes the relaxing part out of it. I would recommend to skip this camping spot if you don't own a tarantula.
Nice location on the lake. The campsite is nice and basic. Bar at reception. Friendly and helpful staff. Take your own toilet paper. Mosquito repellant is a must.

Nice, but expensive campsite. Tents can be placed next to a lake, which is really cool. Toilets aren't really clean, lots of bugs and there's no toiletpaper or handsoap available. Other than that, the owner is really helpful and friendly and there's plenty of shade.

It's a lovely place with quite many places near the lake but has some few drawbacks. Firstly wifi is only near bar, there is no hot shower (0.5 EUR for 5 min), no toilet paper, bathrooms are not cleaned offen (with bugs) and there are no actual spots, so in our case one night we found another tent in our car place. Not much privacy. Mini market is poor as well and there is no restaurant near. Nevertheless the host was nice.

Although the location of this camping is great, the camping itself is horrible. It felt like they tried to profit out of foreigners by deceiving them. We ordered a bottle of wine at the bar and they decided which bottle, and of course it was the most expensive one. The facilities were being painted so you could go to the toilet and have a guy standing around in both the male and female bathrooms.
There were old refrigerators and pieces of wood lying around the campsite and the whole thing looked like a working site. 
There are no trashcans on the site with the exeption of the ones at the entrance at the bottom of the hill.  Also no chemical bathroom disposal in sight. 
Seems like the campsite was made for people with cabins there and they couldnt care less about campers. 
I have had lots of nice experiences in Spain but this wasn't one of them.
If it wasn't for the beautiful river adjacent to the campsite this would be the worst camp I've ever been to.

Tutto da riscoprire e da vivere, 365 giorni l'anno.

comments: Cabins are in a good setting. The reception here is very nice.

Great Thai food in the restaurant. Cabins and rooms in a beautiful setting right next to rice fields. Ping pong table, weight machine, and bicycles for guests. Nice wooden walking paths all around the resort. Didn't stay here because passing by at lunch time, but wanted to.
Nice Place Good View Best Service

Hern Tai Resort, a fantastic place you should be here. The room is cozy and clean with very beautiful nature view. Cost is reasonable. Also, free bicycles are provided for you to look around the local people culture in Mae La Noi.
Great place to sleep the night. Clean and good service. Beautiful view

name: Fuang Fah Camping
location: 51 moo 10, Tambon / Chang Khoeng, Amphoe / Mae Chaem, Chiang Mai 50270, Thailand
comments:
Inscredible place to spend a warm summer night! 
Hosts speek fluently English, French and Portuguese, which makes staying much more enjoyable for long conversations!
The photos are not as good as the real view, which is much better! Keep following Google maps, even when it seems you are too much off-road!
The place has a restaurant and food is home cooked, just delicious! For sure I will return, since it is the perfect place to stay on the mid way up to the summit!

What a cracking place! We rocked up at 6pm with no booking and were welcomed with open arms by Laurent and his wife. We spent the whole night having a laugh with them all and enjoying delicious food and drink. Such a beautiful location too! One of the best nights of our holiday, we will be back!! :)
Very friendly host family, amazing view. Located close to mae hong son loop. I arrived really late and became a heartly welcome.

I'm so happy that I choosed this place! ... If you want to stay in a five star hotel you are definitively at the wrong address but if you search for an experience away from the stereotyp "pataya/full moon Thailand" I can greatly recommend this place. In the middle of the nature with the doi inthanon in its back and only a bark of a dog or the scream of an eagl "disturbing" the quietness it is the perfect place to escape the hustle and bustle of Bangkok or other places. Even if the place is amazing the thing which made me to write this comment, are the two more than friendly hosts! From the first second I felt welcomed. Couldn't imagine a better start for my journey ! Hope I can visit you some time in near futur again :) I wish only the best for the two of you !

Unique place, beautifully located with the most friendly and helpful owners.
There are many places to visit that aren't known to tourists yet.

name: Wander Land Campground
location: Thandikudi-Sithodu Rd, Pulla Veli Village, Tamil Nadu 624212, India
comments: Still have my ears ringing with the sounds of silence. Was exactly what I was looking for, a thorough getaway from the frenetic urban jungle. No cellular reception, no cacophonous roads, just a handful of friendly people and nature unsullied. To say more would spoil potential surprises, but the accommodation is assuredly comfortable and Vishwanath is a great host. Definitely coming back!
Beautiful place on the hill

name: His Rest (Devashanti)
comments:
Great place with a Christian theme outside the city for a get-together. Very friendly and helpful people. Extremely clean.
More than just one group of people can be there depending on the size of the crowd.

A very good place for Christian prayer, camping and retreat. Away from the madding crowd and traffic of Madurai. The people are friendly, polite, helpful and honest. The place is beautiful offering picturesque landscape. Love this place. The charges are very reasonable and moderate.
Wonderful place, very ambient in the midst of nature. Filled with peace and godliness.
Excellent place for retreats. Very quiet and set in the middle of forest area. Excellent food and comfortable accommodation.
It's a quiet and peaceful one, pollution free, nature above all good lodging one with halls for Camp and retreat for Christian program

name: Kodai-camp, Habitat Explorers Pvt., Ltd.,
location: W1/1214, Bharathi Anna Nagar, Pethuparai (Post), Perumal Malai (Via),, Tamil Nadu 624101, India
comments: Worst thing is the food.It is pathetic.Don t even think to eat it. Chapathi and poori s are like disc plates. And tea/coffee is like worst ever had. And the place where tents are located is open field with no trees to give you shade and you cant sleep after 7am, due to direct sunlight hits into the tent. The tent will turn into a hot furnace. you can keep water bottle jnside to get hot water if you need. And also located 20 kms far from kodaikenal. No towels/soaps/paste will be provided. Think before you choose.
Located in outskirts of the town. The staffs were welcoming and friendly. Had an amazing 1 day stay.
Good view nice place to take a break from the city..
Good for group getto...
Secluded place to spend a weekend. Barbeque, bon-fire in the night and sleeping in the tent is memorable.

name: Wild Pasir Panjang
location: Pasir Panjang, Pulau Tuba, 07000 Langkawi, Kedah, Malaysia
comments: great place. absolutely quiet. feel like0 robinson crusoe.i booked the doorm...so i sleep like under the sky...open room.very easy. good handmade fresh food (thai style). only be careful and remeber that this resort is only reachable by boat. if you take the cheap shared boot could be you wait many hours for transfer to and back. you can charter a boot but its more expensive! 60myr plus...one way and at the pier they trie to ask for more money...but if youre there...its special and i think there are no many places on earth like this...
Wow

name: Anawangin Cove
location: Anawangin Cove, Pundaquit, San Antonio, 2206 Zambales, Philippines
comments: A beautiful cove that is slowly being discovered by tourists. No fancy amenities. Great place to go if you want to be one with nature. This cove used to be bare but after the eruption of Mt. Pinatubo, the ashes made the land fertile and 20 years later tall majestic pine trees adorn the serene landscape. A short hike inland would lead you to a beautiful waterfall. No hotels at the cove but anyone is welcome to pitch a tent and camp.

Anawangin Cove is a best place to spend with your friends or loved ones. There is no electricity or signal and it will give you more time to spend with them. Chat, talk, sing and play with them. The beach is clean, specially the end part of the curb on the right when facing the sea. We enjoyed camping and swimming.
Had a great bonding with my friends here. We did lots of fun and activities. Just make sure you bring enough food so you won't starve. Hehe.
I didn't expect this place to be this beautiful. I want to stay here for camping on my next visit. You can even do 10 minutes trekking for a breathtaking view.

Beautiful place. A wonderful experience to camp there overnight and get in touch with your inner girl/boy scout. The night sky is also different from what we see in the city.  It's also a great place to hang out with friends and not have the distraction of electronics. The place can get a bit crowded on holidays and the weekends. But I think that just adds to the fun. The more the merrier, right? However, there is a problem with a lot of people going to Anawangin and that is people tend to throw away rubbish all over the place. The campgrounds literally have trash bins all over the place but people can't be bothered to put their rubbish in the bins. For people planning on visiting Anawangin, please don't litter. It's a beautiful place and we'd like it to stay that way.

A nice place to spend the night! Affordable rates, and great sanitary facilities.

Very nice. Keep up the good work. Wishing you all the best.

name: Parky's Wonderland
comments: What a wonderful stay. The management and staff are the nicest friendliest people. The park is super clean and the facilities are fantastic. I would highly recommend this park to anyone looking for a holiday

This was a truly amazing day.  My Granddaughter was a little upset that she was slightly too small for the rope course.  But we were assured she could do it next time. üòÅ 
*Laser tag was fantastic fun.  It appears best, played with 2 teams (so 4 people in total, but we 3, had 30 minutes of awesome  fun anyway) 
*Mini Golf, that we were told usually takes 40 mins, took 1 hour neat.  That was Great for us, as we were looking to utilize our time, the best way possible!!
*My Granddaughter loved the indoor play room.  And although adults are not supposed to go in it.... We noticed some did... And I think they should be able to, as kids can and will be kids and get ouchies or boo boos.  It did not appear to be clear on the venue, whether adults could go in.  But we were cautioned against it at the office.

My one and only complaint is that although there are vending machines strategically placed around the facilities. (with junk food... chocolates, chips and soft drinks) There didn't appear to be a place to get substantially nourishing food.  Yet you are not allowed to bring in your own food.  That was very disappointing.  (You lose A Star for this..... I'm Happy to give 5 stars, if this is remedied. üòä)  
Still.... I am Delighted to recommend your venue and we will visit again soon.   Thank You
Absolute rip off $24 for 2 small kids and not even a real play centre go somewhere else don't get ripped off here
Great family activities and lots of fun
Fun

Very friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable and clean cottages. Perfect stop if you heading up to the snow.

comments: Have stayed here many times with family and friends and love it! Highly reccomend

Nice spot but way too expensive! We paid 84$ for a powered side with 4 people sleeping in one vehicle.
Also the owner + service is strange and bad.
Stayed in Driftwood Lodge, very clean and comfortable.  Great hospitality and clean amenities.

name: Seaspray Caravan Park
location: Cnr of Shoreline Drv & Futcher St, Seaspray VIC 3851, Australia
comments:
üëçGreat facilities in a neat clean and pretty new park... management/park personel really helpful and thoughtful. Plenty of room. Easy access to beachüòé. Away from the maddening crowds. üòä 
ü§î Trees need to grow though.... perhaps a little lacking in shade. Also, no local fuel and only eats from the local PO and take away. Reminds me of Philip Island 50 years ago ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Very good facilities. Always very clean. Biggest problem with this park is you are so exposed to the weather because there is no trees. When the wind picks up your in trouble.

Why are you all crammed into parks up the coast. Here you can have it all cool crisp mornings,great fishing, great markets, whales dolphins kangarooYou won't get better facilities anywhere or friendlier managers.
You can keep the northern coasts this is just sensational

Great place. Clean facilities, full kitchen and recreational room for the kids with a tv. All the sites are massive and have power & fresh water taps so you don't have to walk far to fill up a water drum. Really windy as it's a flat open space but can't complain as you are only a short walk from the beach. Staff are really friendly. Will differently come back.

Great facilities and staff.  Busy and noisy during peak periods.  Very windy and fully exposed to the weather.  No fires over summer until easter, so it loses a 'camping feel' for the kids.  Overall, it's a nice place which we prefer outside peak periods.

name: Golden Beach RV Rest STOP area
Spoon Bay Campground
comments: Free campground with toilets; very close to the lake. The area is separated into bays surrounded by trees, so it feels private. The day we arrived a huge swarm of jelly blubber had washed up on the beach. Also had some issues with mosquitoes too - even in June!
Nice and isolated, with facilities. Not busy, beautiful lake. Rare Parkland where hunting Duck and Hog Deer is legal, in season.

A relatively unknown and hard to get to campground. It only had one other camper there on Australia day which I guess is peak season. You could make it into there with a two wheel drive SUV since they have more ground clearance, but I wouldn't try anything smaller, and definitely not with a trailer unless you have something really heavy duty. The ground is all sandy so you risk getting bogged down hopelessly. There's a nice tent spot just before the main camp ground. Very worth it when you get there. you have access to the lake, great views and it's free. Take some bug spray.
